name: Art Of Valor
text: So incredibly beautiful! 2nd highest point in the state of Alabama. So much wildlife and such a neat and peaceful place to explore.

name: Tony Craig
text: Fanning Trail - decent challenge of a trail at times - moderate at best - well marked and ample parking. Good options for easier trail loop via Jones Valley Loop & Stevenson Trail.

name: Ellen George
text:
Just an FYI the parking lot is behind a church. When we first arrived at the destination, we were confused and thought Google had taken us to the wrong place, but it is indeed a hiking trailhead. Just drive behind the church and you will see a sign with the trail mappings.

Beautiful little hiking spot with a nice little stream. Not too busy but the trails are a bit messy/chaotic and it is hard to make sure you are still on the path. For that reason I did remove a star. Overall still a very nice area though. The waterfall was very small when i visited, despite it being spring so do keep in mind that it is highly seasonal.

name: 高村政克
text:
(Translated by Google) It is a spot that you can enjoy only now that the corona is bad.
I am visiting to relieve my daily stress and lack of exercise.

(Original)
コロナ禍の今だからこそ楽しめるスポットです。
日頃の溜まったストレスと運動不足解消に訪れています。

name: Ben Cunningham
text:
Loved this hidden treasure!!! We were visiting the USS Alabama and happened to notice an area of the grassy field was cut shorter than the surrounding grass. It was obviously intentionally cut this way to serve as a pathway.

No signs were posted so my daughter and I decided to investigate. I'm glad we did otherwise we never would've known about the little boardwalk/pier that led to a 2-level gazebo over the marshland on the other side of the tree line. As a bonus, while we were at the gazebo, we looked down and saw a VERY REAL alligator!!! It wasn't huge but it was certainly an adult worthy of respect! It's the only time I've seen an alligator in the wild and is a memory I'll share with my daughter for many years to come.

Oh...one more thing...my daughter also accidentally dropped her phone into the water about 10 from the gator. I'm offering a $25 reward to anyone brave enough to retrieve it for us!!! LOL :)

name: Herbert Henry
text: Awesome place, I just hope that people who visits the place be more sensitive with their trash.

name: Russell Gilder
text: Beautiful

name: Mack Daddy
text: Very beautiful scenery except for people dumping their trash

name: April H
text: Peaceful place to get outdoors ♡

name: Brian Dunaway
text: Key cave was a great little preserve. We spent multiple hours here watching a meteor shower with very little light pollution. It was beautiful out there and I look forward to going back to explore more.

name: Leah Nix
text: Such a beautiful place to explore in the city of Florence.

name: Miles Koester
text:
(Translated by Google) OHOO MANE !!

(Original)
OHOO MANE!!

name: Amy Walker
text: Beautiful piece of quiet woods right in the bustling heart of Mobile...

name: David Mcdonald
text: Natural park not alot of traffic,  must contact Landtrust for access.

name: Joe Sandra Brice
text:
We loved it! Such beautiful scenery and so available by a very well maintained trail. Thank you.
Joe and Sandra B

name: Emmily Battles
text: Great place to walk and relax and enjoy the out doors, with family and friends , for the great peace and relaxation of the doors and wildlife, as well as waterfalls.

name: Jonathan Dees
text: Excellent place for mountain biking, hiking , and running. Be sure to get map of trails next to chapel at top of falls .

name: Krystin Gentry
text: Beautiful trails. You will enjoy

name: Lizzards Pawpaw
text: Love it best place ever if you like out doors

name: Ann Amos
text: Very beautiful in the fall all around great place to enjoy the outdoors

name: Kristi Smith
text: Uneasy feeling.I don't think it a safe place for 2 women.

name: Racheal Campbell
text: Beautiful

name: K. Miller
text: Beautiful hike, easy enough for the kids.

name: Craig Priestley
text: Wildflower Trail and Fagan Springs are perhaps my favorite trails in Huntsville. The flowing creek which originates from Fagan's Spring accompanies you the entire trek with beautiful deep pools and sheer rock bottom shallows. There are large 5ft + drops in the creek bed if you explore far enough up the stream beyond the point where Fagan's Spring connects with the main creek. Though dry every time I've seen these falls, they are excellent to climb and view. And of course you can connect to other extensive trails connected to these via the Monte Sano system. These trails are a must-see.

name: Richard Johnson
text: very good place for memories

name: Joey Clapper
text: Very quiet and serene place,off the beaten path. Located just outside Chocolocco Management Area. The road down to it is currently close, but you can park and walk about a hundred yards to it.

name: Bri Herrick
text:
Great hidden treasure and the school garden is amazing. Will visit again and post pictures. Not a huge area, but great walking track and the couple of trails looked inviting. The kids play area was clean, the recycled turf is great for their miniature limbs, and plenty of families were there without overcrowding.

Don't look for grilling or pavilions here, but just a quiet, nice, relaxing stroll or trek, this can definitely fit the bill.

#FruiityDredReviews

name: Crystal Murphy
text:
The trail is well laid out and fairly easy to traverse. There is a pretty creek and a beautiful bridge.
The playground is mostly fenced and fairly quiet. I love that there are restrooms available as well.

name: Andrew Reeves
text: Great community park to take the little ones. Bathrooms are air conditioned and maintained adequately.

name: Edmondson Wright
text: My family and I walk here often, nice trail and creek. We have seen rabbits, snakes, turtles, raccoons, and frogs. Plenty of fun local wildlife and hiking.

name: Gary Hosking
text: Great place to see nature, take a hike or just to get away from it all!

name: Lauren Thompson
text: Gorgeous and easy hike!! Do make sure you aren’t there during school hours (7-2:30ish), as the trail is closed to the public when kids are there!

name: a x v a n I I
text: Blue Ridge Nature Trail is not as good as I thought it was. As you first go in through the gates, it is hard to spot the entrance to the trail. Not only that, it is very gloomy and almost looks as if nobody has been there in a long long time. The trail is great for hiking but is very bushy and home to some snakes I spotted when I was there. Not only that, the map seems old and outdated along with the trail being very small. I do not think it would be a great place for someone who loves hiking to go and hike there. I also forgot to mention the creek is not the type of creek you would think. It is dried up and has no type of marine life whatsoever. But as I said, i do not recommend this place at all for anybody to go hiking or walk the trail.

name: Kathleen Kryger
text: This trail is relatively easy to access (once you've found it) and has some nice walking paths, benches, and wooden bridges. The stream flows well when there's been some rain. It was gorgeous when it snowed, but we've visited since then and it's still nice.

name: melanie a
text: Public outdoor basketballs courts are hard to find but this one is good. Discreet and clean

name: Michael McCluskey
text: It is great for familey outings and weekend getaways and  and a great get away from the same ole every day ruteen

name: Dawn Cole
text: Not kept up. Broken steps, impassable paths from fallen trees.

name: Fredrick Ikpelue
text: Nice neighborhood park

name: Susanne Kibelka
text:
(Translated by Google) Nature trail from 6 years

(Original)
Naturlehrpfad ab 6 Jahren

name: Paul Young
text: One of the best Nature Preserves that I have experienced. This place hosts something for everyone of all ages. Just minutes south of Huntsville. Must see!

name: Timothy Wyant
text: Clean and friendly park. So glad it's open again. Bring the family for a swing and fishing. Kid friendly with a great playground.

name: Chris Karr
text: My family and I have lived in the area for about 2 years now. This park is within minutes of our house. Great place to run, bike, picnic or my personal favorite, to fish. We have three boys, 9, 4, and a 7 month old. The two older ones love the playground here and we often bring our bicycles. Fiahing is great! I fish baitcasters and fly fish. I mostly fish for bass but there are other fresh water species. Overall, this a great place that fits our outdoor needs.

name: Martin Bachtel
text: It’s ok but not nearly as cool as the Moss Rock Preserve in Hoover.  This one needs better maintaining.  On the playground, quite a few of the benches are infested with carpenter bees.  One of the see-saws has a broken handle.  Lots of litter and trash on the playground.  The coolest thing on the playground, the giant swing, is now gone.

name: John Mark “Mark” Hester
text: Great place right off the highway. Creative offerings for kids. Not your typical playground!

name: Samantha Rice
text: What a fun free spot right off the main road in Owens Cross Roads! Our son loves the park and the walk around the pond! The pond walk has plaques with animals facts and a book to read as you walk. He enjoyed running sign to sign!

name: Brandy Wilkerson
text: Their Earth day event was great! Many vendors and local organizations there to show what was going on in the community with regard to environmental and social issues. Very interactive tables. Beautiful area for kids to play. Great trails and able to fish.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! So glad you came to Earth Day!  We are already planning next year's festival! It's going to be amazing!

name: Raymond Theriault (Raym)
text: The lady watching over the grounds was very helpful and knowledgeable.  Visiting was a joy.     :)

name: Sushi52KCCO
text: Great place to take your kids, to get out in nature and just enjoy yourself. So calming

name: Gerald Russell
text: Great Nature Preserve with a playground, fishing, and hiking by the river.  Shaded for summer!

name: Cathy Sumner
text: This is a great place for family photos and the playground is awesome! Lots of stuff to see and areas explore

name: iamb4njos
text: Wonderful little reprieve from the world. Loved watching the turtles.

name: Tracy Werner
text: It was hard to keep track of my grandsons since the playground is so spread out. One of my grandsons tripped over a tree stump that was hidden under leaves and scraped his shin pretty good. It is definitely a nature playground.

name: Carmen Hunter
text: My family loves going to Hayes! Play at the playground, go for a nice walk, ride your bike, fish in the "lake". There's a whole afternoon's worth of fun or relaxation to have!

name: Gloria Berger
text: This place was so beautiful and my children absolutely loved the playground.  We did just the short trail around the pond, but it was still nice and super easy for the kids. We will need to come back to do the other trails and we can't wait. We went around 2 pm and it wasn't too busy. The playground had plenty of shade making it a perfect playing spot.

name: liz stead
text: I love this little hidden gem. It was our first time we went to take photos and play. It has great photo ops and clean bathrooms.

name: Mary Baldwin
text: Such a nice peaceful place to enjoy nature..

name: Geoff Suiter
text: Really nice trail, Huntsville did a good job with the Greenway!

name: Laura Melinda
text: We love Hays! They have great spots to get in and get out of the river for swimming and kayaking. They have a super incredible nature theme park for kids that is very unique and fun for mom and dad too, try their giant swing! They have a cute little pond that’s great for fishing as well and lots of trails and fields. The trail around the pond has interactive things for kids, like a story book that has a page posted every few feet, or animal trivia. It’s such a great place!

name: Claire Tomlin
text: Open and educational! The fresh air and wildlife were amazing!

name: Jim Bo
text: Great place to spend some time outdoors

name: Rob Keating
text: Favorite place for the kids. Feelings have changed since the big swing is gone

name: Gary Holt
text: Lots of walking trails, one piece of advice, take a picture of the map that is posted since there are not any to take with you, plan on an hour or even two to complete the longest trails. Bring a sandwich and a drink and a trash bag for waste.

name: David Keel
text: Beautiful place. Great fishing. I usually drive here from Athens. Definitely worth the drive. :-)

name: Tiffany Sefa
text: Great park loved the educational aspects as well.

name: Ernie D
text: Nice Place To Take The Kids.

name: Emma Troupe
text: Love it...so quiet and peaceful...great scenery...read a book, fish, or take a walk...

name: Christopher Crankshaw
text: Accidentally stumbled onto this place. Very rustic but cool. The giant swing was a hit with the kids. The place was clean. Parking was sparse.

name: Callie Slack
text: Nice park! Lots of pokestops

name: Brian Hood
text: Great place to take the family for a nice stroll through the woods. Easy trails and a nice playground make this fun for kids as well!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often! We will be adding new programs and features during the upcoming year!

name: Jessie Zucnick
text: This is a great place to spend the day.   Clean bathrooms, great trails, great playground!

name: Redz Tablet
text: Beautiful place to be on a beautiful day!

name: Matthew Powell
text: Nice paved trail that goes towards the golf course and publix

name: Tara Donofrio
text: It was possibly the best park I've taken the kids to, quiet and lots of new things for them to do

name: Amy Shipman Guiles
text:
Wear. Bug. Repellant.

Tyrannosaurus RexMosquitoes... 🦟

Beautiful area w uinique playground at the entrance

name: donna collier
text: It was a wonderful walk for me and my dog we had a great time I was suggested to anybody and everybody

name: Jill Turner
text: Had a great time on the playground with my nephew.  He especially loved the climbing pieces and the music area.  A beautiful day to walk around the pond.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! We are so glad your nephew enjoyed the playground. Hope you visit often.

name: Gretchen Gipson
text: Beautiful, natural, trees everywhere, spaced ou,t natural play equipment. This place sparks the imagination.

name: Victoria Word
text: We had our engagement photos taken here in November 2016, and it was wonderful. The preserve is absolutely stunning in the fall, and seems to have a little bit of something for everyone. Definitely a great place to take a family day trip to, or go solo to bike/hike the trails.

name: Brittney Mcillwain
text: The kid's really enjoyed our walk on a trial!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! So glad they enjoyed walking on a trail. Hope you will check out all the activities, programs and festivals we have year round!

name: Denis Osipychev
text: Nice calm place. Perfect for walking, cycling, bird and nature watching.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  So glad you enjoy visiting Hays Nature Preserve!

name: Jeff Bohler
text: Nice little park with many activities for young children.

name: Gary B
text: Very pretty and peaceful place

name: Andy Johnson
text: Beautiful outdoors game life

name: teresa vann
text: Nice place to walk in nature

name: Jacob Buck
text: This destination has alot to do and fun for all ages! Very much a worth while visit!

name: Djae
text: Nice park to take your family for a day out. Lots of trails and the fishing is pretty good.

name: Darryl Gutierrez
text: This park is a hidden gem ! My kids aged 2 and 5 loved every minute. The playground is situated next to a small fishing pond. A family of geese was swimming in the pond when we pulled up. The playground was so unique and well thought out! It was mostly made of rustic wood and was an imaginative kids dream. There was a fort, a play house, a huge swing, a tunnel, rope bridge, seesaws, sandboxes, a music area, and tons of other equipment. My kids also loved the animals that were carved out of wood and scattered around the park. There are lots of great photo ops as well!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! So glad you enjoyed the many features! We have a few more to add and cannot wait for everyone to see and enjoy them!

name: oldworldTECH
text: Beautiful land on the river. We had some amazing photos done for my daughters 1st birthday. Will definitely be back when the weather is warmer.

name: Kristi Jones
text: Very nice and clean easy for a handicap person to access it

name: Bryan Campbell
text: Nice park with fun, easy trails.

name: Aaron Pendergrass
text: I love our parks! Well maintained walking and biking path. That follows along the river. I always feel so far separated from the hustle and bustle of life when I make a little time for Hayes.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  So glad you enjoy your time and Hays Nature Preserve and hope you visit often.

name: Rustam Radjabi
text: Cool place

name: Debra Carter
text: Awesome place to go with your family we make plans to go every year for the Earth Day festivities and are very impressed with the wonderful facilities in this beautiful area. Thank you to the Hays family for allowing it to be used for so many wonderful events and we plan on visiting much more this year to have some family picnics and hiking or fishing. There are lots of different things for all ages.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  We are so glad that you enjoy visiting Hays Nature Preserve! We have a lot planned for Earth Day this year too!  See you on April 20th!

name: Mike Hammer
text: One of our favorite place in Huntsville

name: Scott Whitt
text: Great place to go hiking

name: NeetarNeet
text: This is a very nice preserve. Great wood made playground with swings for all ages and all sorts of equipment for children. Great hiking, but most of all bring your bike. This Greenway connects to two others... You can bike for a long time with no worries about cars.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review and the comments! Hope you visit again soon.

name: Clay Weisenberger
text: This place has a quirky-cool playground, fishing pond, open fields, and multiple trails.  Great place for a family day the kids.

name: Gina Wakefield
text: Every chance we get! It's a great place and you keep it so clean even the restrooms!  Thank you for a great place to take the grands!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star rating!  Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Brandon Buckman
text: Super sweet little place

name: Tammy Anthony
text: All I can say is that it's Gods country. Attended my grandson Bryce's birthday party. We had an adventurous day. They have a large Park the kiddos love. Fishing, both walking and hiking trails.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 4-star review! So glad you enjoyed visiting, and that your family celebrated a special occasion here! Hope you visit again soon ---- maybe we can earn that 5th star.

name: J C
text: Average nature preserve. Mostly paved, could benefit from some unpaved trails. Has a playground for kids... not sure wha th issues on the playground.

resp.text: Thanks for visiting Hays Nature Preserve.  There is so much to see within the 538 acres with more than 10 miles of paved and unpaved trails. Hope you will visit again soon.

name: Risa Mendelson
text: We ride our bikes through the preserve and we enjoy looking at the scenery.  It is a well maintained bike trail.

resp.text: Thanks for the five-star review. Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Talisa Robinson
text: We love visiting this lovely place! The summer kids program, Play days at Hays is our favorite! The playground is amazing and we have also enjoyed exploring around the Nature Preserve. It's Mother Nature at it's finest!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Darrell Webb
text: I love chicken my children to this park never a shortage of things to do there fish hiker play

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! Watch for the new features we have planned for 2020. Hope you visit often.

name: Ann Watkins
text: Enjoyed the visit but they close the gates to earlier. Some people needed help and couldn't get in to help them. They needed a trailer to load there boat on. 8:00pm would be a better time to close gate's in the summer months.

resp.text: Thanks for your review and comments. So glad you enjoyed the visit. At this time the Preserve is open 6am to 7:30pm.  Our hours are normally adjusted June 1 for the gates to close at 8pm to extend everyone's summertime enjoyment time.

name: Stephen Bell
text: Nice area, needs maps of trails but nice playground area for children

name: Tatum Roberts
text: One of the best local places for kids. Our family could spend the whole day there. Best of all, it's free!  They have picnic tables, a huge wood playground, and fishing. If you need some alone time, there are plenty of running and hiking trails. During the week it's pretty deserted. Except the occasional field trip day. On the

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review and the compliment! A great team has put lots of planning and work into the Preserve over the past 8 years. We are adding more programs this Fall and next year! Hope you will come and check them out.

name: Ben Eubanks
text: Great fun for the kids, outdoor activities. Best swing I've ever seen!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great review! We have some new features planned for 2020 too! The big swing --- yes, best in the state for sure!

name: Blanca Booker
text: Great place for family to visit, also the offer special activities for our special need individuals.

name: Addie Sanderson
text: Beautiful place to walk and just enjoy nature. Their earth day event is to die for!

resp.text: Thank you for the great rating and for the compliment on Earth Day! Hope you make plans to be at this year's festival on Saturday, April 18! We are planning the biggest festival yet with so many new activities.

name: Ben Smallwood
text: Great place for the kids to play in the natural material playground. Has spots available for fishing and great walking/activity trails.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Alabama Reloader
text: We always enjoy hanging out over at Hays...my daughter loves to run around and play at this unique place. Highly recommend it.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star rating! Hope you are able to visit Hays Nature Preserve often and participate in some of our events for children, with their favorite available adult.

name: Misty Whicker
text: Nice to walk the trails and fish swing and watch my son play on the woden playground and don't forget the huge rope swing

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great rating!  Glad you and your son enjoy the playground! Check out some of the programs we have for children, with their favorite available adult!

name: VICKIE JOHNSON
text: Great area for children to play and use their imagination as well as just go for a walk. Love the big swing.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star rating! Hope you are able to visit Hays Nature Preserve often!  So glad you love the big swing. We have proclaimed it the best swing in Alabama!

name: Ellen Helton
text: Our family loves Hays! The setting is perfect for a picnic and there is a good variety of trails. Our children especially love the playground which is very unique and has many different play options. We love that it is shady and had bathrooms.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  It is humbling that so many enjoy the playground.  It was the first of its type in the state and one of the largest Arbor Day Foundation certified playgrounds in the nation. We've put a lot of planning and sweat into its design and upkeep over the last 9 years.  Hope you will come to some of our Play Days at Hays programs this summer.

name: No one Important
text: I love this place and so do my kids I love that it doesn't have just a bunch of plastic toys to climb all over. everything is is built by hand and made of wood great place do you have small birthday parties and it's a great place to have photos taken... Engagement graduation maternity just cute pictures if you haven't been go

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  So glad you enjoy visiting Hays. Check out our Play Days at Hays June schedule. Lots of fun for children with their favorite available adult!

name: Summer Crook
text:
It is absolutely beautiful there. The only issue I have is that it closes at 5pm, which in the summer is extremely early.
**Update. They do in fact close later during the summer. 😊

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 4-star review. Our summer hours are 6am-7:30pm, so there is more time to enjoy since days are longer. Hope you will visit again soon - maybe we will earn that 5th star.

name: Bai Bai
text: So beautiful we love the outdoors and kids had a blast playing here! The playground is amazing!

resp.text: Thanks for the great rating! Glad to hear that the kids had so much fun! We have a few new surprises for the playground and some added features in other areas that all will love. Hope you visit often!

name: Karyn Spicer
text: Went for a 3yr olds birthday party.  It was a great area for the kids to run around and play. Just the right size where you could see them playing all over.  Nice shaded area all around, trash cans and bathroom facility. We will be back to explore more!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! The playground was designed with visibility in mind so children can feel like they are roaming in the woods while you are able to watch them. So glad that you enjoyed being here and hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Chris Plott
text: Beautiful place to just sit and enjoy the lake or let you kids play on the playground. Also a great place to get family picture made.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! Hope you visit again soon.

name: Jim Eastman
text: Awesome place to take the family.  Hardwood hand crafted playground equipment,  fishing pond, hiking trails  and picnic area.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Nick Vivian
text: Love this preserve...ride bike and jog through here all the time. They have a great play ground for the younger kids!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit again soon!

name: Rebecca Rideout
text: miles and miles of trails for walking, biking....enjoy the Flint River. some benches and picnic tables available. maintained nicely.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Summer Hipp
text: Unique and beautiful place. Great for the kids and the parents.

name: Ivan Leon
text: Great long trails near HSV

name: Alexis Dobbs
text: BEAUTIFUL JUST GORGEOUS !!!!! SUPER RELAXING. GREAT KIDS PLAYGROUND. NATURE TRAILS HORSE TRAILS AND FISHING. SWIMMING TOO!!!!!  I go here at least twice a week just to soak up the pureness of nature. No i am not being paid to say this either. I just love this place. Ran into a rat snake onve picked it up and put it into. The forest away from where i was fishing.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! We are so glad that you love Hays. A great team has put a lot of planning and sweat into the Preserve's design and upkeep over the last 9 years. Hope you will come to some of our Play Days at Hays programs this summer and watch for our Fall Saturday Series as well as Yoga by the River.

name: Austin Kintzler
text: Wonderful and beautiful. Features a lake, plenty of trails, and a play yard in a perfectly shaded and themed clearing.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star rating! Hope you are able to visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Ashley Tate
text: This is a fun place to take you're kids and go fishing

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! So glad you enjoy visiting and fishing here. Hope you visit often.

name: Sierra Southard
text: My niece loved it. She was smiling the whole time

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! So glad she enjoyed it! Check out our Play Days at Hays schedule! Lots of fun for children with their favorite available adult.

name: Gean Johnson
text: Nice place. We were there with a family group consisting of kids from 2 to 12 years old. We started with a picnic at the pavilion in the playground area. The kids enjoyed that area a good bit. Then we rode bikes to the greenway trail with the bridge and then rode the greenway for a bit. Greenway was very well maintained and very scenic.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  Glad you enjoyed several of the areas of Hays Nature Preserve. Hope you visit often!

name: Ads Crane
text: This is one of the best greenways we have been on to date, as far as scenery. There was a gorgeous deep river and a couple of big bridges to cross. I thought it was a little short, as far as greenways go, but we did not know it crossed over the road and connected to another greenway, so we are looking forward to that the next time. Great place to spend an hour or so, and I would love to see the other parts of it.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve again soon and explore more of the 538 acres.

name: Christopher Foeller
text: Well maintained and has a very good diversity of low land trees, perfect for your budding dendrologist

resp.text: Thanks for the great rating! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Victoria Holdean
text: Kids love the playground area up front, and the paved path that crosses the river is nice. Haven't been in a while, but you need to plan accordingly if there has been a lot of rain as the path across the river floods over. If the river is really high, I'd keep to the main park side of the river.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! So glad the kids love the playground! It was the first of its type to be certified in Alabama and is one of the largest in the nation. There are many trails in the 538-acre Preserve. Good advice - when there has been a good bit of rain the trails near the front in the higher areas are the best bet for exploring. Hope you will visit again soon. Watch for the new programs and features on the playground we will add in 2019 - one is a story time/book and exploring club for kids.

name: linda jones
text: What a great experience this morning. So fun to watch the kids play. Whoever built this should be really proud of themselves because they certainly have created something nice for all of us to enjoy!! Thank you Hays family.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy visiting Hays Nature Preserve! We are adding a few new features and many new free programs this year!

name: Leslie Lo
text: Love this place!! The play area is creative and well spread out. They've recently added bathrooms which is awesome! And lots of nature trails and paved walking options.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoyed your visit to Hays Nature Preserve!

name: Nicole
text: We had a wonderful time exploring the kids area and planning future visits with our children. Beautiful, creative, unique area.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  Hope you visit again and check out some of our programs for children and families.

name: Mike n Micki
text: Love coming here w my husband n kids! Kids love the Indian themed playground n Ft Hayes.  A lot of nature things n educational stuff for the family.

name: Michael Trott
text: Nice swamp, many birds, all very natural state. Nice playground for kids. Will come back. (Visited on July 2014 -- sometimes Google Maps says it's closed, but it's open.)

name: John “Mr.Herber OC” Herber
text: Great place to bike and run.  Looks like a great place for kids and is also pet friendly.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy biking and running here! You are right it is a great place for kids and for pets. Hope you visit often.

name: Sandy Archer
text: Wonderful creative playground for kids of all ages!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! So glad you enjoy the playground, which was the first of its type in Alabama. We are glad that so many people appreciate it and make fun memories there.

name: jynni Thor
text:
Beautiful place to run! Wish there were some restrooms however!

Edit 2019: Nice air conditioned restrooms are now located at the park's child play area, but a Port-a-Potty remains the only option if you are back where the paved trails are (and there is only one).

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 4-star review!  We were so excited to have the portable restrooms removed from the front part of the Preserve when the permanent restrooms were constructed.  Maybe one day more can be added.

name: Debora Pederse
text: Charming wooded play area! Perfect for children of all ages!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! The playground was the first of its type in Alabama to be certified. We will be adding more features this year.

name: Ryan Anderson
text: Huge open spaces, well maintained, and a one id a kind shaded playground for the kids

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome rating! A talented team works to create new and maintain existing features. Glad you like the playground! It was the first of its type in Alabama and one of the largest, if not the largest, of its type in the nation. Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Tucker Campbell
text: Beautiful

name: Nathan Coffman
text: Great family friendly trails and beautiful wild flower patches.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! Hope you will visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Brad McClellan
text: It's always a nice playground. Walking trails are great too.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Nico N. (Nico)
text:
Great place to take the kids, or to go alone. They have an extensive playground for the little ones, as well as trails for hikers, bikers, and horseback riders.

The paved trails have separated biking and walking lanes, which is a big plus for me as a biker!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  So glad you enjoy many of the activities you can do here!  Check out our Play Days at Hays June schedule.  Lots of fun for children with their favorite available adult!

name: Timothy Francis
text: Nice place to get away from the city. Great place to take kids.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Amie Rivera
text: It is a nice free place to hike and has a playground the kids love.

resp.text: Thanks for the 4-star review! Hope you will visit us often at Hays Nature Preserve and participate in our free programs for children. Maybe we can earn that 5th star.

name: JJ Jayne
text: Great shady playground

name: Kirk Ward
text: A great place to take the family.  Well maintained and the trails/roads are easy to walk on or ride on.  Definitely a "Must Visit" place.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy Hays Nature Preserve and hope you visit often.

name: Andy Bennett
text: This park has an awesome play ground, and I can get a 4-6 mile run in too!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy some of the many activities Hays Nature Preserve has to offer.

name: Comell Moore
text: 24 members of the John Watts family recently visited Hays Nature Preserve.  Each and every one, from the youngest  to the oldest totally enjoyed the Preserve.  One from Italy caught her first fish, the eldest swung in the longest swing ever and just about everyone took a turn in the hammocks.  Can't think of a better outing place for good family fun.

name: Shuttered Wings (Kary)
text: Beautiful. Great place for photographers. Great place for jogging, hiking, walking. Good place to fish also. Has a kids park, too.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  Lots to do within the 538-acre Preserve! Glad you enjoy spending time here.

name: Mike Nauman
text: Nice place to take kids for a walk or go fishing. They have a pond, and a small river on the property. There were building a bathroom on my last visit so that's awesome.

name: Britany Caudill
text: Did my brothers senior pictures here. Beautiful and lots of places for pics. I LOVE the adorable Indian themed park with the tee pees and the huge swing.

name: Adam Garcia
text: Great place for kids and walking..plus lots of opportunity for pokemon go

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: JoN JoN Santiago
text: Very nice place for a stroll with the family.  They also have a nice pond to fish.  The only downside is the gate close at about 7 pm to get in and there is no lighting.

name: Darryl Bailey
text: Fun place to just walk around.

resp.text: Thanks for the great rating! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Kim shelton
text: Fishing, walking nature trail, playground for kids, kayak launches.  I launched my kayak and fished for a while.  This area is nice around the Flint river.  Beautiful!

name: Rosanne Heiliger
text: Beautiful place, lots of play structures for the kids made out of natural wood, fishing and hiking trails, on a hot day it was nice under the trees....

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review and the compliment! A great team has put lots of planning and work into the Preserve over the past 8 years. The playground was the first of it's type in Alabama and is one of the largest certified ones in the nation. We are adding more programs this Fall for children and for adults. Hope you'll check them out.

name: Shane Parsons
text: Great place to walk

name: Scott Seeley
text: Very unique playground in shaded areas and both ponds and streams make this one of our go to places. More trails than you can walk. Lots of wildlife.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  So glad to be one of your go to places! The playground, certified by The Arbor Day Foundation, was the first of its type in Alabama and one of the largest in the U.S.  We are working on some new features to be added this Fall and early next year!

name: Kathleen Dunseith
text: It's great but they need more sand for the sand boxes.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! We do have a challenge keeping sand in the two areas.  We find piles moved to many different areas of the playground as children use their imaginations. We'll keep adding it and hopefully the areas will be full, or close to it, on your next visit. Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: NICOLE DUNN
text: Great place to go for lunch or.to take the kids to play. In the summer it's the most shaded playground in the area. Great walking trails, picnic area and beautiful  views.

name: Bruce Long
text: The playground is fun for young children and in the shade. The nature trails are a beautiful adventure and the water is nice to look at. Well maintained...and a great place to spend time in nature.

name: Christina Beal
text: Beautiful place. My kids love to play here and I took my daughter's birthday photos there.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  So glad that your kids enjoy playing here! Check out the programs we have for children and families this Fall. Details on November 17th's Fallen Leaf Festival will be published soon

name: Glenda Neal
text: Very nice and peaceful. My friends and I enjoyed it....

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: David Mullins
text: Excellent venue for families, so creative and wonderland like. Kids are in awe. However, sorely in need of some maintenance. Anxious to take my grandkids back.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy Hays Nature Preserve. The playground was the first of it's type in Alabama and is a very popular place. Needless to say it can quickly show some wear even after repairs. Unfortunately we have seen some children be a bit hard on some of the features too. We will continue to make repairs to maintain this special place.

name: Penn2walk
text: Attended for earth day with the family and we thoroughly enjoyed the attractions and the environment. We enjoyed skipping rocks at the lake and taking turns on the seesaw.

resp.text: So glad you enjoyed Earth Day at Hays Nature Preserve. Thanks for the 4-star review! Watch for the new features/programs we are adding - maybe we can earn another star.

name: Nyla McCoy
text: This is a versatile park with many activities run by Operation Green Team.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-star review!  We hope you visit often.

name: Sarah D
text: Lots of fun things for kids to do. Our kids loved it. We will be back for sure.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star rating! Check out our Play Days at Hays June calendar --- lots of fun for children, with their favorite available adult.

name: Greg Parde
text: No better place in Huntsville to spend time with the family outdoors, walking, biking or on horse back.

name: Justin O
text: Beautiful scenery, nice trails and kids enjoyed the fishing and playground!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  Glad you had a good time - please visit us again soon!

name: Ginger Shaneyfelt
text: Great play ground and great summer time atmosphere for family and kids Birthday parties

resp.text: Thanks you for the 5-star review! So glad you enjoy coming to Hays, and yes this is quite popular for birthday parties!  We love seeing all ages enjoy the Preserve.

name: Nathaniel Anderson
text: We've lived in the area for less than a year, but Hays has become our go to place to let the kids play or go for a nice walk

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Darren Abbott
text: Great little walkway for people interested in a casual stroll or biker ride.  It is nice and flat, and mostly shaded.

name: Edward Dehelean
text: A sweet breath of fresh air.

resp.text: Thanks for the 4-star rating. Hope you visit again soon --- maybe we can earn that 5th star.

name: Jon O
text: Beautiful area, with a free flowing river, numerous hiking trails, and an area for the kids. Great place to take the kids and let them explore nature as a family.

name: Jason Glover
text: Beautiful place to carry ur kids too.....

resp.text: Thanks for the 4-star review. Hope you visit again soon - maybe we can earn that 5th star.

name: Joan McWilliams
text: Kids loved all the hand made benches and play grounds.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  So glad that they love the playground and benches. Hope you will check out the many programs we have for children with their favorite available adult too!

name: Joseph R
text: Hays Nature Preserve is a gem for anyone who loves the outdoors. Well maintained and a great place to hike trails on foot or horseback.

name: Ashley Pallotta
text: The best hidden gem around! They have an awesome playground, beautiful trails, beautiful pond, etc.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoyed visiting Hays Nature Preserve.  Watch for the new features/programs we are working on. Our goal is to keep the Preserve a gem!

name: Claude McGovern
text: Wife and I had a nice walk around the lake.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  So glad the lake area was not affected by the flooding so you could have a nice walk. Hope you visit again soon!

name: Mike Venegas
text: Great outdoor spot for kids & parents. Could be muddy after a rain so plan accordingly.

resp.text: Thanks for the 4-star review!  You are so right! There is much fun to be had in puddles and mud after a rain! Rain boots and clothes that can get dirty while exploring and playing are a great idea!

name: christopher call
text: Great place for fishing and relaxing. And it has a great play area for kids!

name: Samuel Hunt
text: There's lots of shade. Good for about 1.5 hrs. On playground.

resp.text: Thanks for the 4-star review! Watch for the new features/programs we are adding - maybe we can earn another star.

name: Becky Champion
text: Beautiful!!!

name: Alicia Hernandez
text: Love love love this place and so do my kids! Such a cool place and  beautiful for photos!!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy visiting Hays Nature Preserve! We are adding a few new features and many new free programs this year!

name: Nate Smith
text: Fun place for kids. There is a playground in front beat the freeway, but drive a bit further back and there are lots of trails.

name: Aaron Hearne
text: Lots to do here! A great park for kids, lots of biking/walking trails, fishing and points to drop a canoe in!

name: Paul Christ
text: Wish I had this place to take my kids to when they were young I love it now and I'm old lol

name: V Sensei
text: Great place

name: Gavin Smith
text: Pleasant walking trails, good chance to see some wildlife or birding in the southern low woodlands.   Playscapes for kids,  picnicking, fishing,  and biking,  too.

name: Bradley Dean
text: Love walking /running by the riverside on these well kept paths.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review. Glad you enjoyed your visit to Hays Nature Preserve. Hope you will visit often.

name: B Taylor
text: Nice park with picnic, playground and small pond. Really enjoyable

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy visiting Hays Nature Preserve! We are adding a few new features and many new free programs this year!

name: Stephanie Marie
text: Always absolutely gorgeous here.

resp.text: Thanks for the great rating!  It is beautiful here, in all seasons! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Bethany Kregger
text: Well maintained, good variety of trails and recreation areas great scenery, all around a pleasant place to explore.

name: Lorna Light
text: Great place to walk and also let the kids play and enjoy the outdoors.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Check out our Play Days at Hays schedule! Lots of fun for children with their favorite available adult.

name: Carol Willis
text: Nice place to walk. Ricer floods alot. Only has Porto potty for bathroom.

name: David Fortenberry
text: Gorgeous and pet n kid friendly.a Madison must!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy visiting Hays Nature Preserve! We are adding a few new features and many new free programs this year!

name: Bobby Godsey
text: Always love the atmosphere at hays.

resp.text: Appreciate the 5-star review! It is a wonderful place for many reasons - we love the atmosphere too!.

name: Juston Bohannan
text: Very nice place!  The fish weren't hungry though. :)

name: Candice Talley
text: Great place, kids really enjoyed it, and little to no money is needed!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  Glad you enjoyed visiting Hays Nature Preserve.  We have fun, educational free events for children year round!  Hope you will check the schedule and join us for one.

name: Sean Biggs
text: Beware the mosquitos during the summer but aside from that, the landscape is beautiful with plenty of places to ride your bike, fish, or hang your hammock for a few hours.

resp.text: Thanks for the 4-star review! Yes you can encounter mosquitos especially on humid days. As much as some of the critters here like to eat them they can be pesky for humans and some animals. Your preferred insect repellent/essential oil is a good idea to keep them at bay. We will keep working to earn that other star.

name: Michael Goshen
text: Good bike trail, nice walking trail, pond to fish, a good playground for the kids.

name: Thomas Scarbrough
text: A beautiful place to spend some quality time with the family.

name: Damon Stone
text: Nice place to hike around, even though I almost step on a snake

name: Justin Morgan
text: Great place to fish with kids or play at the shaded playground.

name: Bethany Burbank
text: Very beautiful place 😍😍

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great rating! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often! Love seeing the beauty of all seasons!

name: Sean Maloney
text: Beautiful place to walk around and take in all the nature.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy Hays Nature Preserve and hope you visit often.

name: Nathan C. McVeigh
text: Lots of shade and a convenient bathroom.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Jacob Lirette
text: Great fishing

name: Nicolas Hoots
text: Very nice park for walking trails, play equipment, and a little bit of fishing

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy Hays Nature Preserve. We'd love to know what you catch out of Bar Lake. It was stocked a while back and we'll stock it again in the next couple of months.

name: Doug
text: Great natural setting, outdoor views, river walk

name: Jackie Talley
text: Supper pretty but not much to do

resp.text: Thanks for the 4-star review! We hope you will visit Hays Nature Preserve again soon. Check out the free events scheduled to see if there is something of interest.  We'd love to earn that 5th star!

name: JEFFREY ROBINSON
text: Fun outgoing for the family the park the kids had a blast playing in

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! So glad they had a blast.  Check out our Play Days at Hays schedule! Lots of fun for children with their favorite available adult.

name: Tracy vandergriff
text: A beautiful place to visit....Have a picnic !

name: Robert Greene
text: Lots of fun for small children, and the large rope swing is fun for everyone!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star rating!  So glad you enjoy Hays Nature Preserve!

name: James Matthews
text: Beautiful place I've been watching the baby geese grow up everyday

name: DGS DGS
text: Nice, relaxing, great for family time.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Jimmy McMurry
text: Great place, play ground BBQ grill and lake

resp.text: So glad you enjoyed visiting Hays Nature Preserve.  Please note that fires and grilling are not allowed at the Preserve.

name: Etta Phillips
text: Really enjoyed with the grandkids

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star rating! Hope you are able to visit Hays Nature Preserve often! We have a lot of programs for children with new ones added this Fall.

name: Beabea Beabea
text: Great place to walk.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy walking here and hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Scott A
text: Nice place

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 4-star review! Hope you visit again soon - maybe we will earn that 5th star.

resp.text: Thanks for the 4-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve again soon. Maybe we can earn that 5th star.

name: allen Henry
text: neat place to go for a walk of fish

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy walking and fishing here! There are some really good-sized fish - let us know if you hook one.

name: anthony Parton
text: Great place for kids.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often and participate in our educational programs.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! Hope you are able to visit Hays Nature Preserve often and relax.

resp.text: Appreciate the great rating! There is beauty here in every season! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: William Patterson

resp.text: Thanks for the 4-star review. Hope you visit again soon - maybe we can earn that 5th star.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the 5-star review!  Glad you like our educational workshops! This year we are expanding again the workshops/programs we offer for all ages!

name: Amber Walden
text: Great place to walk!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review. Hope you visit again soon.

name: Chris Daugherty
text: The best and most unique playground!! Very shaded!!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  So glad that you enjoy Hays Nature Preserve with family and friends. Hope you visit often.

text: Great for hiking, biking, fishing, pictures.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great rating! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

text: Don't know

resp.text: Thanks for your review. Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve again to see all it has to offer for outdoor recreation and relaxation.

name: Heather Spielman
text: I love it there

resp.text: Thanks for the 4-star review! We love it too and are planning some new features and programs, so maybe you will love it even more and we can earn that 5th star.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy Hays Nature Preserve and hope you visit often. We will be posting information soon about fun events for families this Fall.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! The playground was the first of its type in Alabama and one of the largest Nature Explore Classrooms in the country. We are adding a new feature in September - one so many have requested.
